image.title: Striking View
image.caption:
Lightning strikes beyond the rim of Arizona’s Horseshoe Canyon in this picture submitted by J. Cho. “It’s just amazing and beautiful,” Cho writes, noting that the movement of the storm in the background makes the scene come alive. Located within Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, the site is named for the distinctive bend of the Colorado River, which flows a thousand feet below the top of the cliffs.

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest.

Download this and other wallpapers >>

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of a lightning storm over Horseshoe Bend, Arizona

social.og:title: Striking View
social.og:description: A lightning storm fills the sky above Arizona’s Horseshoe Bend in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Riding High
image.caption:
The lush greenery of Bangladesh blurs past riders atop a train near Dhaka. The men are heading home to their villages, says Your Shot photographer A. M. Ahad, who captured the moment and submitted it to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest. "I am struck by how still and calm the riders are against the action of the moving train," photo editor Jeanne Modderman says. "[Ahad] captured this moment with great technique."

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest.

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of people riding on top of train in Bangladesh

social.og:title: Riding High
social.og:description: Men travel home atop a Bangladesh train in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Golden Gate Crossings
image.caption:
For this new look at a San Francisco standard, Ross Barringer had to go high—very high. "I was very fortunate to be given the opportunity to take a 'tower tour' of the Golden Gate Bridge south tower," he writes. "Just as I was about to take the long elevator ride back down, I saw an approaching cargo ship and I quickly set up my tripod for what was my very last shot atop the iconic bridge."

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest.

Download this and other wallpapers >>

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of Golden Gate Bridge, San Francisco, from the top of the bridge

social.og:title: Golden Gate Crossings
social.og:description: Take a new—and very high up—look at San Francisco's Golden Gate Bridge in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Flirt in Training
image.caption:
A young Victoria's riflebird practices a mating display he'll need when he's older and has undergone a color transformation: Adult males are velvety black with a bright blue-green crown. This juvenile was photographed in Daintree Rainforest in Queensland, one of the last strongholds of ancient Australian rain forests.

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest. Submit your best photo for a chance to win.

Download this and other wallpapers >>

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of a Victoria’s riflebird in a mating display, Queensland, Australia

social.og:title: Flirt in Training
social.og:description: A young Victoria's riflebird practices a mating display he'll need when he's older in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Death Valley Dunes
image.caption:
The Eureka Dunes in Death Valley National Park offer an eerie soundtrack to visitors who decide to make their way up the sandy slopes—a mysterious phenomenon known as singing sand results in heavy bass notes and drones that sound like they come from airplanes. The booming sounds only add to the desolate beauty of the dunes, the tallest in California.

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest.

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of person walking on Eureka sand dunes in Death Valley National Park, California

social.og:title: Death Valley Dunes
social.og:description: A hiker makes his way across desolate dunes in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Coastal Setting
image.caption:
The setting sun sinks behind the low mountains framing Vila Velha, a coastal city in the Brazilian state of Espírito Santo. Your Shot member Victor Lima captured this dusky view of the bay and its surrounds from the Morro do Moreno, or Moreno Hill.

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Victor Lima, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of the sunset above the bay in Vila Velha, Espirito Santo, Brazil

social.og:title: Coastal Setting
social.og:description: The setting sun sinks behind mountains above Vila Velha, Brazil, in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: A Geothermal Swim
image.caption:
“My Swedish friend and I decided (pretty easily) that a dive into a ... geothermally heated pool sounded abundantly more pleasant than being cold (like we were) during our late summer Icelandic journey,” writes Kelby Singhaus. Hruni’s rolling grass hills and “flocks of poofy sheep” contributed to what Singhaus called an unbeatable moment. “So dive, we did,” he writes, “and warm we were! Until we got out, of course.”

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest.

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of a man diving into a geothermal pool in Iceland

social.og:title: A Geothermal Swim
social.og:description: A man dives into a geothermal pool in Hruni, Iceland, in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Cape Cub
image.caption:
A camera trap set in South Africa’s Cederberg Wilderness records the steady gaze of a Cape leopard cub. Though not classified as a separate subspecies of leopard, these shy mountain cats are smaller than their savanna kin.

See more pictures from the December 2015 feature story “Learning to Live With Leopards.”
image.alt_text: Picture of a Cape leopard cub in South Africa

social.og:title: Cape Cub
social.og:description: A camera trap captures a Cape leopard cub in South Africa in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: All Fall Down
image.caption:
“Autumnal flying at its best,” writes Your Shot member Steve Brockett, who photographed this golf course in Wales from a powered paraglider. Though autumn hadn’t yet come into full swing, Brockett still found his sunset flight over the Monmouthshire valley rewarding. “Isolated points of color draw you to them like sentinels,” he writes. Initially attracted to the near perfect circle of leaves beneath the tree at center, he found that the shadows and light lent the image additional form—and a dose of magic.

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Steve Brockett, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of an autumn tree seen from above in Wales

social.og:title: All Fall Down
social.og:description: A lone tree in Monmouthshire, Wales, neatly loses its leaves in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Sunrise Sweep
image.caption:
“I was lucky to visit Varanasi during the [bird] migration. Morning boat rides are the ultimate thing to do during this time,” opines photographer Razz Razalli, who was in India when he captured this flock sweeping over a rowboat at sunrise. “According to the locals, the birds arrive in November and leave at the end of February,” Razalli writes. The annual migration attracts tourists to Varanasi, and for a fee, boatmen take tourists onto the river for an up-close look at the flocks.

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest.

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of man rowing boat in Varanasi

social.og:title: Sunrise Sweep
social.og:description: Migrating birds sweep over a rowboat in India in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Quiet Reflection
image.caption:
Your Shot community member Freia Lily submitted this photo of an iceberg reflected in the “still waters of Jökulsárlón,” a “glacier lagoon” in Iceland. Detached remnants from the vast Vatnajökull (Vatna Glacier) wash up on the shorelines here, gracing visitors with views of the shimmering blocks before they melt.

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Freia Lily, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of icebergs in Iceland

social.og:title: Quiet Reflection
social.og:description: A chunk of ice is reflected in the still waters of Jökulsárlón in Iceland in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Maneuvers in the Dark
image.caption:
U.S. military special forces members conduct fast rope and hoisting training during exercises at Holloman Air Force Base in New Mexico. According to Your Shot member Jodi Martinez, the service members are part of a program that trains special operators to conduct joint operations.

Martinez’s shot was recently featured in the Daily Dozen.

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Jodi Martinez, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of military helicopter training at night

social.og:title: Maneuvers in the Dark
social.og:description: U.S. special forces members perform nighttime training exercises in New Mexico in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Hard Drink
image.caption:
A polarized-light photomicrograph reveals a crystallized drop of Aperol, a brand of bitter liquor that lends its orange color to the popular Italian aperitif spritz. “I had never taken photomicrographs of drinks ... because there's somebody—Michael Davidson—who does this job at an unbeatable level,” writes Your Shot member Bernardo Cesare. After showcasing Davidson’s work alongside his own rock photomicrographs at a conference, Cesare received a suggestion: Try Aperol. “I did it, and the result is what you see here.”

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Bernardo Cesare, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of a microscopic detail of a drop of Aperol

social.og:title: Hard Drink
social.og:description: A polarized-light photomicrograph reveals a crystallized drop of Aperol in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Go Up and Flame
image.caption:
From a meadow in California’s Yosemite National Park, Your Shot community member Khanh Le snapped this photo of the smoky skyline. As the smoke rises, sunlight blazes through it, turning the haze itself a dramatic, fiery hue.

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Khanh Le, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of smoke coming from a wildfire in Yosemite

social.og:title: Go Up and Flame
social.og:description: Smoke rises in Yosemite National Park and covers the sun, which turns the haze a fiery hue in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Here Today
image.caption:
Photographing from a Cessna, Stas Bartnikas captures a seasonal view of southern Iceland. Bartnikas explains that as glaciers melt in the summertime, rivers start their currents among fractures in the lava fields. “The easiest way to see it is [by] flying above,” he writes.

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest.

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of southern Iceland from the air

social.og:title: Here Today
social.og:description: Rivers flow in the fractures of a lava field in southern Iceland in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Color Screen
image.caption:
Preening brings out the coy side of a blue-winged macaw, also known as an Illiger's macaw. Found in the wild in parts of Argentina, Brazil, and Paraguay, the small parrot is classified as near threatened by the IUCN. Habitat loss and the pet trade have contributed to its shrinking numbers.

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest.

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of an Illiger’s macaw parrot

social.og:title: Color Screen
social.og:description: A blue-winged macaw preens its colorful feathers in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Blue-Sky Night
image.caption:
This photo of Lyngen, Norway’s icy landscape was submitted by Isabelle Bacher. The dark Norwegian winter gives these ominous jagged rocks and swirling seawater an eerie glow, but Bacher enjoys the view. “Dark all day and all night,” she writes, “but a blue light in the sky makes this time magical.”

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest. Submit your best photo for a chance to win.

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of icy landscape in Norway

social.og:title: Blue-Sky Night
social.og:description: The dark Norwegian winter gives these jagged rocks and swirling seawater an eerie glow in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: In the Pink
image.caption:
“[These ladies] were leaving work in the afternoon,” explains Dasha Horita, who submitted this photo of women in India, uniformly outfitted in bright-pink veils and flowered dresses, descending a staircase in the waning sunlight.

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest. Submit your best photo for a chance to win.

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of Indian women in veils walking down a staircase

social.og:title: The Pink Slip
social.og:description: Women in India wearing bright-pink veils descend a staircase at the end of the workday in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: 'Picturesque and Curious'
image.caption:
Out for an anniversary stroll with his girlfriend, Louis Schneider had to step "a bit over the edge" to capture this shot of the Manneporte, a rock formation in Étretat, France. The area has attracted photographers and artists for well over a century: "The cliffs at Étretat are among the most interesting on the French coast," reads a 1915 National Geographic magazine article, "The Beauties of France." "Étretat is a noted resort, especially affected by artists and literary men, who are attracted by its picturesque and curious situation."

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Louis Schneider, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of Manneporte rock formation, Etretat, France

social.og:title: 'Picturesque and Curious'
social.og:description: See the rock formation in France that lures artists in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Pinniped Playground
image.caption:
Photographer Megan Barrett had a ringside seat for this aquatic display in San Diego, California. "I happened upon this group of sea lion pups by chance after photographing smelt that were moving through the reefs around La Jolla Cove," she says. "I had never seen the pups band together like this—they were circling around me, porpoising and enjoying the bait swimming around in the water. It was around noon, so with the overhead light and the surf grass below, I felt as though I was watching children running wild on an underwater playground."

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest. Submit your best photo for a chance to win.

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of sea lions swimming in San Diego, California

social.og:title: Pinniped Playground
social.og:description: Sea lion pups swim in the reefs around San Diego’s La Jolla Cove in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Coastal Commute
image.caption:
Shot in black and white, Marcel Koláček’s recent photo of a scene at the Colombo Fort Railway Station in Colombo, Sri Lanka, looks like it could have been taken decades ago. Indeed, the station has been around for some time—in operation since 1908, it is a Sri Lanka Railways hub.

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest. Submit your best photo for a chance to win.

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of Colombo train station in Sri Lanka

social.og:title: Coastal Commute
social.og:description: A train full of travelers is stationed in Colombo, Sri Lanka, in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Lion Below
image.caption:
A helicopter flying overhead captures the attention of a lioness as she walks through the tall grasses of Botswana’s Okavango Delta. Shooting from aboard the aircraft, Chris Schmid considered the experience a lucky one. “She was ... looking at me, and there’s nothing in Africa so intense as a lion looking right at you.”

This photograph was submitted to the 2015 National Geographic Photo Contest. Submit your best photo for a chance to win.

Download this and other wallpapers >>

Browse galleries of editors’ favorites >>
image.alt_text: Picture of a lioness gazing upward

social.og:title: Lion Below
social.og:description: A lioness looks upward while walking through Botswana’s Okavango Delta in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Water Colors
image.caption:
Seeing familiar landscapes from above lends uncommon and often arresting new views. “The colors, shapes, and patterns in the Great Salt Lake are absolutely stunning. I have always wanted to fly over this particular area,” writes Your Shot community member Jassen Todorov, who captured this striking aerial image of evaporation ponds from just west of Stansbury Island in Utah’s Great Salt Lake.

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Jassen Todorov, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of salt flats from the air

social.og:title: Water Colors
social.og:description: Multicolored evaporation ponds are viewed from the air over the Great Salt Lake in Utah in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Act of Faith
image.caption:
Your Shot member Mukunda De submitted this photo of an actor, dressed as Lord Krishna, seated backstage during a Ramlila performance in Delhi, India. The actor’s closed eyes and faint smile infer a moment of contemplation—perhaps a truly spiritual investment in his work.

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Mukunda De, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of actor waiting backstage in Delhi, India

social.og:title: Act of Faith
social.og:description: An actor dressed as Lord Krishna sits quietly backstage in Delhi, India, in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Beacon Bright
image.caption:
A patient dog makes a long exposure possible at the Yaquina Head lighthouse in Newport, Oregon, captured here by Your Shot member Justin Knott. A working lighthouse since 1873, the 93-foot beacon is a landmark of the Oregon coast’s Yaquina Head Outstanding Natural Area.

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Justin Knott, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of a dog in front of the Yaquina Head lighthouse, Newport, Oregon

social.og:title: Beacon Bright
social.og:description: Oregon’s Yaquina Head lighthouse emits its beam beneath a starry sky in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Shifting Light
image.caption:
Your Shot member Hamed Tabein made an early morning trek to the desert, just east of Esfahan in Iran, to capture this shot of the smoothed sand and a hardy little stand of trees that has managed to grow in a hollow between sand dunes. “[This photo was taken] at around 7 a.m.,” Tabein says. “It's an extraordinary place for landscape photography. I went there before sunrise, and as the sun came up I started [photographing] because of the best light and sand texture ... Two hours after sunrise you cannot see anything except the sand, without any texture and contrast. It would be just a washed-out picture.”

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Hamed Tabein, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of trees at the bottom of a sand dune

social.og:title: Shifting Light
social.og:description: See the early morning sun cast a gentle light on sand dunes and a stand of trees in the Iranian desert in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: A Flurry of Activity
image.caption:
Your Shot community member Stian Servoss says this enchanting photo was taken on a day that actually began as a sunny one in Reine, a small fishing village in the Lofoten Islands in Norway. “I was about to pack my gear as it suddenly started snowing—a lot,” Servoss writes. “I ran down to some fishermen working at the docks to get a few shots of them as they were lifting containers of fish from their boat to land … All of a sudden, I noticed hundreds of birds.” The birds appear to be playing in the snowflakes—though they are more likely attracted to the day’s catch.

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Stian Servoss, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of a snowy fishing port

social.og:title: A Flurry of Activity
social.og:description: Birds fly over a snowy fishing port in the Lofoten Islands, Norway, in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Lead the Way
image.caption:
From his perch on a dromedary camel, Your Shot member Fabio Petti made this image of his guide leading him and his fellow travelers into the smooth Erg Chebbi sand dunes of Merzouga, Morocco. “The Berber you see in the picture was the chief of our expedition,” explains Petti. “[He] asked me to stay first, close to him. This gave me the chance to have only the desert and him in front of me.” After a nearly two-hour journey to their campsite, Petti snapped this photo just a few minutes before sunset.

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Fabio Petti, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of a Berber walking on a sand dune

social.og:title: Lead the Way
social.og:description: A Berber leads a camel and its rider through the Erg Chebbi sand dunes in Morocco in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Reef Refuge
image.caption:
A goby is nearly imperceptible, camouflaged against a gorgonian in the waters of the Republic of Palau—but it didn’t escape the lens of National Geographic Explorer-in-Residence Enric Sala, who  captured this image while making photographs for the Pristine Seas project. When asked how photography plays into the project’s goal to create marine reserves and save the ecosystems he’s so passionate about, Sala says, “Photography and film play a very important role: to share what’s there with people … We need to inspire the leaders and the public emotionally. We need them to fall in love with these places. We bring the place to them—that’s why photography and film is important.”

To learn more about photographer Enric Sala’s work, read the story “A Scientist Becomes a Photographer to Help Save Our Oceans” on our photography blog, Proof.
image.alt_text: Picture of a goby camouflaged against a gorgonian

social.og:title: Seeing Red
social.og:description: A goby is nearly imperceptible against a gorgonian in the waters of the Republic of Palau in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.

image.title: Peaks of Enchantment
image.caption:
While on a four-day road trip through the Scottish Highlands, on what began as a rainy day, Your Shot member Joana Bochecha took advantage of a break in the weather and snapped this image of a shaft of sunlight illuminating the hollow between peaks in the Glencoe Mountains. “It had rained all morning, and just before reaching this spot the sun had broken through the clouds,” she writes, “highlighting not only the vibrant green of the grass … but also creating a mist between the top of the mountains that gives a mystical appearance to this photo.”

This photo was submitted to Your Shot, our storytelling community where members can take part in photo assignments, get expert feedback, be published, and more. Join now >>
image.credit: Photograph by Joana Bochecha, National Geographic Your Shot
image.alt_text: Picture of the green hills of the Scottish Highlands

social.og:title: Peaks of Enchantment
social.og:description: A shaft of sunlight illuminates a hollow between two mountain peaks in the Scottish Highlands in this National Geographic Photo of the Day.
